block.p: T. J. Maxx in Framingham, Mass., the discount retailer owned by the TJX Companies, has invited seven agencies to participate in a review for its broadcast account. Spending was estimated at $20 million.
The invitations come less than a month after T. J. Maxx and its agency, Holland Mark Edmund Ingalls in Boston, parted ways after 24 years.

T. J. Maxx in Framingham, Mass., the discount retailer owned by the TJX Companies, has invited seven agencies to participate in a review for its broadcast account. Spending was estimated at $20 million.
The invitations come less than a month after T. J. Maxx and its agency, Holland Mark Edmund Ingalls in Boston, parted ways after 24 years.

The seven agencies are Bates USA in New York, part of the Bates Worldwide unit of the Cordiant Communications Group; Campbell Mithun in Minneapolis, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies; Cliff Freeman & Partners in New York; Euro RSCG Tatham in Chicago, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising; Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos in Boston, part of Interpublic; Long Haymes Carr in Winston-Salem, N.C., part of the Lowe Group unit of Interpublic; and the Richards Group in Dallas.
